page.title: 08SOUTHWELL MINSTER
page.content: When we went to The Minster it was a cold afternoon. We tried to get in by the north door but it was locked. So we went through the west door. We went on a guided tour through the Minster by a verger whose name was Mrs. Hudson. The font is one of the first things you should see as you come in through the north door. It is put near the front of the Minster or any church because it is the beginning of life. In 1661 the font had to be built again because{Oliver Cromwell}did not believe in children and babies being baptised. The altar is at the end of the nave, it is where parents go to get bread and wine and children get blessed. There is also another altar in the choir and that has mice on it to represent the man who carved out the altar.
